Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría con sus compañeras, y es también una alegría para ella contar  en la comunidad con un Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Mujeres Clavelinas communal bank, located in the Ilave district, part of the province of El Collao in the department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, has 5 children, and completed part of secondary school.

Elsa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years. She tells us that her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she used to increase the capital for her business selling young cattle, including lamb and pig. With time, her capital increased and her business improved and now, she not only sells young animals but also fattens cattle.

She is requesting a new loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she will use to increase the capital for her business selling young animals and fattening cattle.

Her dream is to make her business grow to generate more earnings. What she likes most about the communal bank is sharing the happiness with her fellow group members and she likes having a communal bank in the community.

loans.use: To increase the capital for her business selling young animals and fattening cattle.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón” ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.

Elsa viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 4 años,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de animales menores.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero con la que podrá comprar más animales para su negocio venta de animales menores.
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y las ganancias del ahorro.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Santiago Patrón Communal Bank.  It is in the Santiago de Pupuja district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  She is 49 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a high school education.

Elsa has been working with the Manuela R. Movimiento for four years.  She tells us that with her first loan for 300 soles she was able to increase the capital in her business of selling small animals.

She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 to buy more animals for her business of selling small animals.  Her dream is to have more capital in order to improve her business.

What she likes the most about her communal bank is the easy terms of the loan and the earnings from saving.

loans.use: To buy more animals for her business of selling small animals

loans.name: Jessica Tatiana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Cevallos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Éxito, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Jessica, ella tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad la cual está en el primer año de educación básica, su marido realiza transporte escolar en su carro.

Se dedica al comercio, arrienda un local en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo donde vende zapatos de niñas, nos cuenta que ya son tres años que lleva en este negocio y que gracias  a Dios le ha ido bien, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, cuenta con la ayuda de una ayudante a la cual ella le paga un sueldo. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y también le traen del Perú.
  
Este crédito es para viajar a Guayaquil este fin de semana a traer más zapatos de niñas.  Es socia de la Fundación Espoir desde el año 98 pero se cambio a este Banco Comunal hace 2 años y está muy conforme aquí ya que las socias son muy cumplidas y responsables.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio local y ahorrar lo que paga en arriendos.
texts.en:
The 'Damas de Éxito' (Successful Ladies) community bank meets every two weeks in the Cevallos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal, urban area of the city.

Here we find Jessica who is 32 years old, married and has a 5 year old daughter who is in her first year of elementary school.  Her husband buses children to school in his car.

Jessica is a merchant.  She rents her business premises in Portoviejo city center where she sells children's shoes.  She says that she has been in her business for three years and, thankfully, it has done very well.  She works every day from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She has help from an assistant to whom she pays a salary.  She buys her goods in Guayaquil and also gets them in from Peru.

This loan will be used to travel to Guayaquil this weekend to buy more children's shoes.  She has been a member of Fundación Espoir since 1998 but she moved to this community bank 2 years ago and is very happy here since the members are very punctual and responsible.

Her dreams are to have her own premises and save what she pays in rent.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes

loans.name: Elvia Teofila

texts.es:
Elvia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”  ubicado en el distrito,  Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y con 04 hijos, la señora tiene estudios hasta 5to de educación secundaria.

Elvia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/.  1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para la compra de diversos productos para incrementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Su sueño es tener una tienda grande de abarrotes y poder vender comida.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Elvia is a member of the community bank “Santiago Patrón”, located in the Santiago de Pupuja district, in the Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 42 years old, married and she has 4 children. She has completed her studies up until the 5th year of secondary school.

Elvia has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years. She says that her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. This money was used to increase the capital of her grocery store business.

She is now requesting a loan for S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles. This money will be used to purchase different products to expand her grocery store.

Her dream is to have a larger grocery store and to sell meals.

The things she likes most about her community bank are the meetings, the punctuality, the responsibility and the training.

loans.use: To buy different products to expand her grocery store business

loans.name: Francisca Marleny

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”  ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la señora cuenta con estudios de Educación Superior Completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de animales menores.

Francisca solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invertirá en su negocio venta de animales y frutas.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una propia empresa de productos lácteos y queso

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la organización, puntualidad y el tema educativo.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the community bank “Santiago Patrón”, located in the Santiago de Pupuja district, in the Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 27 years old, single and she has one child. She has done university studies.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. The money was used to increase the capital of her business, selling small animals.

Francisca is requesting a new loan of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles. This money will be invested in her business of selling animals and fruit.

Her dream for the future is to have her own cheese and dairy product business.

The things she likes most about her community bank are the organization, the punctuality and the educational theme.

loans.use: to invest in her business of selling animals and fruit

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”  ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 03 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.

Florentina viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de cuero, lana, carne y productos de la región.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invertirá en la compra de lana, carne y productos de la región para su negocio.
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the community bank “Santiago Patrón”, located in the Santiago de Pupuja district, in the Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, married and she has 3 children. She has completed her primary education.

Florentina has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. She tells us that her first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles. The money was used to increase her business’ capital, selling leather, wool, meat and regional products.

Florentina is requesting a new loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles. This money will be invested in the purchase of wool, meat and regional products for her business.

Her dream is to have more capital for her business.

The things she likes most about her community bank are the punctuality, the responsibility and the savings she earns.

loans.use: to buy products like wool, meat and regional products for her business

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. Ilave, departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años D. edad, estado civil casada, con ocho hijos y con grado D. instrucción primaria completa.
Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, el cual le sirvió para la compra D. insumos como harina, manteca y levadura para elaborar pan.
La señora solicitará nuevo préstamo D. S/.1500.00 Nuevos soles, esto le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. pan.
Su sueño es conseguir que crezca su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría.
texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the Communal Bank “Miraflores”, which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, Ilave Province, Department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and has eight children. Florentina completed elementary school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for four years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 500 PEN, which she used to buy flour, butter, and yeast for making bread.

Sra. Florentina is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can increase her capital for her bakery. Her dream is to continue growing her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is sharing in the happiness.

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil casada, grado de instrucción segundo de primaria, con cuatro hijos de y uno a su cargo.
Elvira viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace seis años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de s/. 300.00 nuevo soles,  el cual invirtió en la compra de insumos para preparar el delicioso jugo de Quinua que a diario vende.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá comprar los insumos por mayor para su negocio de venta de jugo de quinua.
Su sueño es tener una librería.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión y los regalos que se compran por navidad y por día de la madre.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Communal Bank “Gran Poder” (Great Power), which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has a second grade education. Elvira has four children, one of whom is still in her care.

She started working with Manuela Ramos six years ago. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of supplies for preparing the delicious quinoa juice that she sells every day.

Elvira is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can buy supplies in bulk for her quinoa juice business. Her dream is to open a bookstore. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the unity and the gifts that are exchanged for Christmas and Mother’s Day.

loans.use: Purchase supplies in bulk

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is the owner of Data Alliance Information Technology, a network hardware business. He founded the company in 2007 after working for a company that performed similar operations but without the focus on customer service that Michael really values. 
 
At his previous job, Michael worked his way up from sales manager to controller, and realized one day, while the owner was away on vacation, that he knew enough to run the company himself. He has since proven that his instinct was correct: less than a week after starting his own business in July of 2007 he had made his first big sale, and this past year the company experienced a 350% growth rate. 
 
Not just getting through the recession but growing through it is something that Michael cites as his greatest accomplishment thus far. Michael explains that, as he saw the economic downturn begin, “I knew I had to kick it into another gear. I’ve worked 15-hour days, six days a week, and thanks to hard work we are growing. It’s a very exciting time for us!” 
 
Despite his experience in the industry, high customer retention rate, and business growth, Michael was repeatedly turned down when he approached banks for a loan. “I don’t know how many times I sat there and they told me they could lend to me, and then declined me because in the end I didn’t have collateral. It didn't matter that I had been in business for three years and had seen a large increase in sales... I couldn’t believe it!” 
 
A $8,000 loan from Opportunity Fund will act as a reliable source of working capital, something that is necessary for Michael to fill his customers' orders in time and avoid bank fees, and to continue growing the business. He is hoping to soon be able to hire additional employees and move the business from a satellite location to a commercial office space. “I’m always striving to go the distance, and go beyond what I’ve already accomplished.” 
 
To find out more about Data Alliance Information Technology, visit: www.dataallianceit.com

loans.use: Working capital to increase inventory and successfully fill customers' orders on time, without accumulating bank fees

loans.name: María Benilda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Cevallos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Éxito, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por el apoyo que le brindan  tanto a ella como a sus amigas con los créditos, además que los créditos son fáciles de conseguir sin tantos requisitos. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera y tuvo 4 hijos de una relación que tuvo hace muchos años, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella.

Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de llaves, tiene un pequeño taller en el centro de la ciudad donde día  a día realiza su trabajo el cual empieza a las 8am y lo mantiene abierto hasta las 18h00, trabaja sola y en ciertas ocasiones uno de sus hijos le ayuda,  nos cuenta que todos los días llegan muchos clientes hasta su local a que les realice su trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar materia prima para la fabricación de las llaves. Sus sueños son tener un taller con mayor infraestructura y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The 'Damas de Éxito' (Successful Ladies) community bank meets every two weeks in the Cevallos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal, urban area of the city.

María is a founding member of the community bank and she likes the support which it gives both her and her friends through its loans.  What is more, the loans are easy to access without so many requirements.  María is 56 years old and is currently single.  She has 4 children from a relationship which she had a long time ago.  Her children are now grown up and two of them live with her.

María makes and sells keys.  She has a small workshop in the city center where she carries out her work every day.  She starts work at 8.00am and stays open until 6.00pm.  She works alone and sometimes one of her sons helps her.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers coming to her store every day for her services.

This loan will be used to buy raw material for making keys.  Her dreams are to have a workshop with better infrastructure and to continue in good health.

loans.use: To buy raw material to make keys

loans.name: Gred

texts.es:
Gred es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y no tiene  hijos, la señorita continua con sus estudios de educación superior.

Gred viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 350.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de salchimote.

La señorita solicitará un nuevo préstamo de  S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar maíz, pollo y otros insumos más para su negocio de venta de salchimote.
	
Su sueño es tener un capital propio, tener trabajo y no tener deudas.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y el apoyo mutuo.
texts.en:
Gred is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and does not have children. Gred is continuing with her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Gred says her first loan was in the amount of 350 PEN, which helped increase her capital for selling “salchimote” (a dish consisting of corn, chicken, and sausages).

She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 700 PEN so that she can buy corn, chicken, and other ingredients for her “salchimote” business. Her dream is to acquire her own capital, continue working, and not be in debt. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the punctuality of the members and the mutual support.

loans.use: Purchase corn, chicken, and other ingredients

loans.name: Diorice Soraya

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Cevallos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Éxito, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

La señora Diorice tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido 4 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos vive con ella y dos nietos que son hijos de su hijo mayor que vive en Quito y que son como sus hijos. Su marido es albañil.

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta mas tarde ya que no le incomoda porque su tienda está en su casa, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo en el Comercial Gonzalo Zambrano que es donde le sale más barato.

Este crédito es para surtir más su tienda con productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta por las facilidades de pago y por los créditos que le ayudan mucho en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa bien construida ya que una parte de su casa es de caña.
texts.en:
The Damas De Éxito (Ladies of Success) communal bank meets every two weeks in the Cevallos neighborhood of Portoviejo, a crowded, marginal, urban zone of this city.

Diorice, 41, is in a common law marriage and has had four children all of whom are adults.  However, the youngest of them still lives with her along with two grandchildren who are children of her oldest son, who is living in Quito.  She loves her grandchildren as if they were her own.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She has a small grocery store that’s open every day from 6am until 8pm, sometimes even later, because since the store is located in her home it’s not inconvenient for her.  She buys her stock in downtown Portoviejo at Comercial Gonzalo Zambrano which is where it’s less expensive.

This loan is to stock her store with basic needs items.  She has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it because of the ease of payments and for the loans that help her a lot in the business.

Her dream is to have a well-built house because part of her house is made from sugar cane stalks.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Cevallos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Éxito, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y siempre le ha gustado por la ayuda que recibe por parte de la Fundación Espoir con los créditos y otros beneficios que le han dado, además por las facilidades de pago. Tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos todos menores de edad los mismos que estudian, la mayor en primer semestre de universidad y los otros en escuela.

Se dedica al comercio en venta de artículos para el hogar (licuadoras, planchas, camas, colchones, ollas, etc.) trabaja de lunes a viernes, su sistema de ventas es por cartillas, esto es que enseña la revista donde están los productos a los clientes ellos le piden lo que necesitan y ella los anota cuando tenga cubierto el límite que les permiten realiza los pedidos luego los va a recibir en la distribuidora y entrega el producto a los clientes de acuerdo al número que se les anotó. Deja a crédito y cobra por semana.

Este crédito es para pagar los pedidos de este mes ya que su capital esta invertido en el pedido anterior. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The 'Damas de Éxito' (Successful Ladies) community bank meets every two weeks in the Cevallos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal, urban area of the city.

Carmen is a founding member of the community bank and she has always liked the support which she receives from Fundación Espoir with their loans and other benefits which they have given her.  She also likes their easy payment terms.  Carmen is 37 years old.  She is a single mother with three children who are all minors and studying.  Her oldest is in their first semester at University and the others are in school.

Carmen sells products for the home (blenders, irons, beds, mattresses, pans, etc.)  She works from Monday to Friday.  Her sales system is 'on request' which means she shows her customers a catalog of products, they order what they need and she notes it down.  When she has reached a certain limit, she places her orders, receives them from the supplier and delivers them to her customers.  She leaves the products on credit and collects payments every week.

This loan will be used to pay for this month's order since her capital is tied up in her previous order.  Her dream is to have her own home since she lives in her parents' house.

loans.use: To buy blenders, irons, pans, etc.

loans.name: Hermesa Barisa

texts.es:
Hermesa es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y tiene 02 hijos a su cargo, la señora tiene estudios hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.

Hermesa viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de carnes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el que podrá comprar más carne vacuno para su negocio.
	
Su sueño es salir adelante con el negocio de venta de carne.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Hermesa is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, single, and has two dependent children. Hermesa completed her studies through the third year of high school.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for seven years. Hermesa says her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN, which helped increase the capital for her meat business.

She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 400 PEN so that she can buy more beef for her business. Her dream is to continue moving forward with her butcher shop. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and the training seminars.

loans.use: Purchase beef to sell at her butcher shop

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the village of Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Lolita is married and has 2 adult and 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of goods in the local community. She just started this business.

 In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used as additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Alicia's Group

texts.en:
Alicia P. is from the village of Cogon, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married, and has three adult children. Alicia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Alicia P.’s Group.

To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a flower shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2010, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy more flowers to sell. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used as additional inventory and working capital for her flower shop expansion. This loan will be the second taken out by Alicia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital for flower shop expansion.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao. She is 56 years old, married, and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, particularly in fishing. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting her 1st loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Emelia A. is from Cogon, Ozamis City. She is 51 years old, a widow and has three adult-aged children. Emelia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emelia A.’s Group. 

Emelia owns and operates a business making and selling food, snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In March 2010, Emelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from PMPC. Emelia is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita C. is from the village of Montol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Elenita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Elenita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and for motorcycle maintenance. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina D. is from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Divina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Divina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina is requesting her first loan of 3,000 PHP that will be used as additional capital.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for farming

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin O. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is 18 years old and married. To make a living, Jasmin raises hogs to sell. Jasmin has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jasmin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin is requesting her first loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used for hog raising.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For hog raising

loans.name: Nellys Maribel

texts.es:
Nelly  de 25 años de edad, vive con su mamá quien le cuida a su niña de  7 añitos y que estudia educacion primaria, es madre soltera pero recibe ayuda econòmica del papà de su hija, labora para el Ministerio de Educaciòn en la Escuela Rubèn Darìo desde hace 6 años de donde recibe sus ingresos mensuales para sus gastos basicos. 

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva con financiamiento  para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion, ya que pretende Repellar y ponerle piso a su casita; esta clienta ha demostrado ser una joven responsable con sus pago de sus crèditos anteriores y es bien querida por sus vecinos y amigos. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida que su familia permanezca siempre unida, gozar de salud y estabilidad laboral para poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida ya que son una familia bien humilde.
texts.en:
Nelly, 25, lives with her mother who babysits her 7-year-old daughter who’s in elementary school.  She is a single mother but does get some economic help from her daughter’s father.  She has been employed by the Ministry of Education at Rubén Darío School for the last 6 years where she earns a monthly salary to cover basic expenses.

She is asking for Kiva help to buy building materials and supplies because she plans to seal her walls and install flooring in her house.  This client has shown herself to be a responsible young lady when it comes to repayments and she is well liked by her neighbors and friends.

Her greatest dream is that her family stays together always, to enjoy good health and work stability so that little by little she can improve her living conditions since they are quite a humble family.

loans.use: To seal the walls and install flooring in her house.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo de 40 años de edad, tiene 1 niña de 5 añitos, su esposa es comerciante, el cual lo ayuda con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos, habita en la zona # 3 del Municipio de Nueva Guinea; labora para el CETA  INATEC  desde hace 4 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad como inspector.  

El Ingeniero M. se siente bien agradecido con la instituciòn ya que este seria el segundo crèditos otorgados por Kiva por lo que se ha sentido apoyado y  ha mejorado su vivienda y sus condiciones  de vida  Este crédito lo requiere para reparar la cocina  y de esta menera mejorar poco a poco su vivienda. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es seguir estudiando para vivir actualizado , tener estabilidad laboral para asi ayudar a su linda familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 40, has a five year old daughter.  His wife is a merchant who helps him with family expenses and other acquired economic responsibilities.  He lives in Nueva Guinea’s Zona #3.  He has worked honestly and responsibly as an Inspector for CETA INATEC for the last four years.

Engineer M. is very grateful to the institution because this will be the second Kiva loan he’s been granted.  He has felt much supported and has improved his home and living conditions.  This loan is needed to repair the kitchen thereby gradually improve his home.

His greatest dream in life is to continue studying so that he can be up to date and have stable employment in order to help his lovely family.

loans.use: For kitchen repairs.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina de 46 años de edad tiene 3 hijos 2 mayores de edad los cuales trabajan por su propia cuenta y uno que tiene a cargo de 16 años, el cual estudia 2do año de secundaria en el Instituto Rubèn Darìo. 

La Sra. Luz Marina labora como docente de primaria desde hace 26 años en el Ministerio de Educaciòn en la Escuelita Enmanuel Mongalo ubicada en la Zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea.   Està solicitando su octavo  crèdito para con la ayuda de kiva poder construir una habitaciòn con mayor comodidad, la profesora Luz Marina es una mujer muy responsable con voluntad y capacidad de pago. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es  llegar a ver sus hijos realizados que sean personas de bien trabajadoras y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 46, has three children.  Two of them are adults and work independently and one is 16 years old and still in her care.  He is in second year of secondary school at Rubén Darío Institute.

Luz Marina has worked as an elementary school teacher for the Ministry of Education at the Emanuel Mongalo School located in Nueva Guinea’s Zona #6.  She is asking for her 8th loan from Kiva in order to build a more comfortable room.  Teacher Luz Marina is a very responsible woman both willing and able to repay.

Her greatest dream in life is to see her children become well-paid professionals and to provide better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: To add a room onto her house.

loans.name: Maximina Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La profesora Maximina de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien es cliente de AFODENIC y le servira de fiador ya que son una familia bien unida y comparten con los gastos del hogar y con sus compromisos adquiridos, tienen 2 hijos de 9  y 2 años de edad labora como docente de secundaria en el colegio Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 18 años , de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales.

Se siente bien agradecida ya que con los crèditos obtenidos por la instituciòn ha mejorado la infrestructura de su casa y sus condiciones de vida, este crèdito lo requiere para  comprar materiales de construcciòn, pues cambiara techo y realizara mejora a su humilde vivienda . 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia se encuentre bien de salud y tener estabilidad laboral para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y siempre tengan lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Teacher Maximina, 36, lives with her husband who is an AFODENIC client and will be her loan guarantor since they are a very united family and share household expenses and other acquired responsibilities.  They have two children who are 9 and 2 years of age.  She has worked as a secondary school teacher at Augusto Salinas Pinell School for the last 18 years where she earns a monthly salary.

She is very grateful for the loans obtained from the institution because they have improved her home’s infrastructure and her living conditions.  This loan is needed to buy building materials and supplies because she is going to replace the roof and make other improvements to her humble abode.

Her greatest dream in life is that her family is healthy and that she has employment stability so that her children will lack nothing and always have the basics at home.

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting and paving stones.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion G. is a widow who lives in Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food vending business. Consolacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Consolacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, raising the family's standard of living.  For her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the education of her youngest child. Consolacion is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Luisa de 40 años de edad tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad los cuales estudian su primaria y secundaria,  su esposo trabaja para intendencia de la propiedad, ella labora como tecnica de Promociòn y verificaciòn en el programa Usura Cero desde hace 2 años el cual ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y con sus compromisos adquiridos.  

Solicita su cuarto crèdito para remodelar su cocina ya que donde ella labora no puede optar a un crèdito, esta clienta es bien conocida en Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y de buena familia segun referencias comerciales, laborales y personales es bien responsable con sus compromisos.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es ver su vivienda bien bonita, que sus hijos de buena salud y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
María Luisa, 40, has two children who are 17 and 10 years of age and in elementary and secondary school.  Her husband works as a caretaker on an estate and she has worked as a Promotion and Verification Technician for the Usura Cero Program for the last two years.  Both share household expenses and acquired financial obligations.

She is asking for her fourth loan to remodel her kitchen because she isn’t able to get a loan where she is employed.  This client is well known in Nueva Guinea for being responsible and of a good family according to commercial, employment and personal references she is quite responsible with her commitments.

Her greatest dream in life is to have a pretty home, that her children be healthy and that they become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: For home repairs.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.es:
Herminigilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”  ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y con 02 hijos, la señora tiene estudios hasta 5to de Educación  Secundaria.

Herminigilda viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde este año. Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de carne, papa y chuño.

Ahora  solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar mercaderías para su negocio venta de carne, papa y chuño.

Su sueño es tener más capital para el negocio y así enriquecerlo.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Herminigilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Santiago Patrón”, which is located in the District of Santiago de Pupuja, Azángaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Herminigilda studied through the fifth year of secondary school.

She started working with Manuela Ramos this year. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN, which she used to increase her business capital for selling meat, potatoes, and dried potatoes.

Herminigilda is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 200 PEN so that she can buy merchandise for her business selling meat, potatoes, and dried potatoes. Her dream is to have more capital for her business and build wealth. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and the training seminars.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for her meat business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester C. is happy and feels so excited about the support that she has received from Kiva lenders for her fishing business through her previous loans. Ester and her family are very grateful and pray they all be blessed. She has a solid relationship with ASHI, the first Kiva field partner in the Philippines.

Ester and her husband, Margarito, have been able to improve her business due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva lenders. Now the couple is requesting another Kiva loan to continue supporting her fishing business. Ester revealed the massive impact the loans have made on her family, as with the additional income, she was able to afford to buy desired food items for her family to eat, ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI, and cover other needs. 

Ester’s business has been very helpful in achieving her dreams for her children. For her, it is joy to see achievement in her business and in her family. And with her children growing up, she will want to see them having the best in life.

loans.use: To continue support of her fishing business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna M. is from the village of Mitimos, Rizal. She is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna grows corn to sell. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for corn production.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To cultivate corn

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena de 33 años de edad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que labora como docente de secundaria, ella tambien ejerce la misma actividad de docencia en le Esc. Deylin Olivas desde hace 3 años trabajo en el cual se ha destacado por su responsabilidad, no tienen hijos todavia ya que piensan acondicionar primero la vivienda.  

Solicita su primer crèdito y lo invertira en  compra de materiales de construcciòn para construir una habitaciòn y asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, dos hermanas de Maria Magdalena son clientes de AFODENIC quienes son excelentes clientes de la instituciòn y segun referencias comerciales, laborales y personales es una docente bien cumplida con sus compromisos.

su mayor sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de la Educaciòn y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 33, can count on her husband’s support.  He works as a secondary school teacher, as she herself has done for the last 3 years, at Deylin Olivas School.  She has stood out as being very responsible.  They have no children yet because they want first to prepare their home.

She is asking for her first loan that will be used to buy building materials and supplies to build a room so that their home will be more comfortable.  Two of María Magdalena’s sisters are excellent AFODENIC clients and according to commercial, employment and personal references, she is a committed teacher.

Her greatest dream is to finish getting her Bachelor of Education degree and to improve her home’s infrastructure.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. C. is 43 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a carinderia (mini-restaurant), a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Sitio Canggapas, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her carinderia, general store and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. 

Gina is now borrowing PHP 17000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her carinderia and general store. This will be her tenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her carinderia and general store

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty P. is from the village of Bigaan, Mabini, Baliangao. She is 38 years old and married with no children. To make a living, Letty owns and operates a business venture selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Letty has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Letty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Letty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Letty is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to invest in hog raising. This will be the eighth loan taken by Letty from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:

In 2004, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used for rice production. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For rice production

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita A. is from Paliwan, Bugasong, Antique, Philippines.  She is a 63 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. Amelita regrets that all of her children did not finish their studies in college because she could not afford to send them to school.  When her husband died, Amelita had to be both mother and father to her children  During her ups and down in life, no one else was there to lean on and no one could support her.  Only her children give her inspiration to move on and face the different challenges in her life.  While she never loses hope to the trials that she meets in achieving her dreams, she continues to remind her children and grandchildren that education is very important because according to her education is the best weapon for poverty.

Amelita joined ASHI in 2008 because she still has a dream, which is to support her children so that her grandchildren will finish their studies. Her first loan was for PHP 5,000; for her second loan, she requested PHP 9,000, which she will use as additional capital for her variety store and vegetable vending.  Her income from this business is a great help to sustain the needs of the family. She is very thankful to ASHI because the institution gave her the opportunity to see that her dreams for her family come true.

loans.use: To acquire capital for her variety store and vegetable vending

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita N. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: fish vending and pig fattening. Her husband Eliseo N., who is 63 years old, is retired and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are between 13 to 32 years old. Jovita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twenty loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jovita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing 16,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more fresh fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Jovita N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. She has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lida joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional working capital for the business. Lida is requesting a new loan, her eighth from PMPC, of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase pig feed.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic F. is a 53 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Zone 2, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. By working hard in her general store business, Marivic is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.

Marivic has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. Marivic is now borrowing 19,000 PHP to purchase more inventory stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP was paid off well within its time limit and was just another step in Marivic’s journey toward economic freedom. She aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being.

These women have chosen a life-long path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

This time, for her fifteenth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use for additional capital for her rice retailing so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ruth is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Forty-nine years old and married, Bonifacio F., from the town of Sto. Niño, grows rice and raises hogs. While happy that his piggery is growing, Bonifacio wishes to earn more so that he can provide for the increasing needs in his household.

Bonifacio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and piglets, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his enterprises.

loans.name: Luz's Group

texts.en:
Luz L. is from the village of Sigamok. She is 35 years old. Luz is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone defaults or is delinquent.

Luz is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried goods in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010 Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Kungeibai

texts.en:
Kungeibai T. is 41-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and school-aged daughter in their own ger, a traditional housing tent, in Bayan-Ulgiy province, western Mongolia.  His daughter is 8 years old and attends a local elementary school while his wife is currently employed as a servant for a private company with a monthly salary of 60,000MNT. 

Since 2005, he has been operating a welding service in his home and has gained a lot of experience. In his local town, there is not any welding service center; only individuals who do welding privately according to customers' orders. Over many years of operation, he has built his business to a consistent and stable level. His earnings have enabled him to start construction on his house and yard. 

In the future, he hopes to open his own auto repair center. Kungeibai is a hardworking man. He says, "After finishing my house construction, I will save my business earnings and open a bank savings account for my daughter in the future." He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials for his welding business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for welding

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida J. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old. Nelida is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 12. To make a living, Nelida owns & operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelida also runs a sari-sari store where she sells products like sugar, vinegar and also rice. 

Nelida is thankful she joined CEVI because her loans helped sustain her business. She even joked that she wishes CEVI would help them forever but deep inside she hopes to have a stable income and to be able to use her own money someday for capital. Nelida is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Masinulondon, Tabao Proper, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  Fishing and Crab Netting (Panggalan). Her husband, Renato, who is 45 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children, 10 to 19 years old. Luisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to maintain her crab nets and to buy more fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. She will also do some home repairs. Luisa E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida T. is a 66-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food vending business. She lives in Sitio Suol, Barangay Nanunga, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Aida is now borrowing PHP 18000 so that she could continue to fund the operations of her food products. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana (holding the blue book) is a resident of Kamoki, a small industrial city known for its rice and other agricultural crops. She owns a single-room brick house where she has lived with her family for over 14 years. She is 38 years old and makes thread rolls; she gets thread from old worn sweaters and sells it to thread sellers for a profit. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband, M. L., operates a printing shop in the market where he prints newspapers, visiting and marriage cards on order. He has been doing this for over five years. Rehana has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters, all except the youngest one in school. She and her husband work very hard to pay their children's school fees. They want them to complete their education and have successful lives. 

Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s printing business. With the loan, he will buy printer toner, paper and other supplies in bulk to fulfill larger orders on time and generate more profit. Rehana is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy printing supplies

loans.name: Merlita's Group

texts.en:
Merlita I. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 47 years old, single, and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. To make a living, Merlita operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Amalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amalia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to buy additional stock of eggs to resell so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children. Amalia K. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending page on Kiva to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

Merlyn P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old. Merlyn is married and has five children. Her eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is only four. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlyn also plants vegetables in her backyard and earns a profit from it.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz B. is 44 years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Brgy. Bliss, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,500. Beatriz is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stocks to sell.   This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Beatriz aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Safokhudja

texts.en:
Safokhudja is married with two children. He owns an auto accessories store in his hometown. His little vending place is located right in the center of Isfara, which makes it a popular stop for car owners. He sells tires, acoustic systems, and car parts. Safokhudja started this business 13 years ago. Safokhudja is hoping to invest this loan of $2,000 USD in the purchase of more goods to sell. He believes a diversified assortment of merchandise will help meet clients’ demands. Safokhudja has proved to be a responsible borrower, having a repaid previous loan without any late payments. One of his long-term plans is to start a second venture and open a grocery store some day. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Basheeran's Group

texts.en:
Basheeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She will invest the loan money in her eldest son’s motor workshop business, which he has been running for over five years. With the help of a loan, he will buy the latest repairing tools and spare parts of different vehicles to grow his business. 

Basheeran lives in a three-room brick house with her five sons, a daughter and her husband in the area named Tiba Mohammad Nagar, which is located in a city called Kamokay. She is an excellent embroidery expert and spends her time making embroidery clothes to improve the living standard of her family. She couldn’t afford education for her other children and they had to leave their education after completing 8th class. But she transferred her embroidery skills to her younger sons, who are now expert in the work and operate an embroidery shop in the market. Her daughter stays at home and does household work.
  
Basheeran is hopeful that her eldest son will get good results from his workshop business after making this investment and his monthly income will grow which will allow Basheeran to marry him off soon.
 
She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Basheeran.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools and spare parts for motor workshop

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where she has been farming for 12 years. Her farm produces milk, which she sells to a local dairy plant. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea, which she sells locally, and a shop that she operates in the same region. Her primary challenges in farming have been a poor transport system to the markets and the fluctuating market prices of milk.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income from the sale of milk will enable her provide enough food for her family, pay school fees for her children and meet any other expenses for her family. She hopes that in five years time, she will have a fully established dairy farm.

Angeline is 36 years old. She is married with five children who are now between the ages of 6 and 13. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

texts.en:

He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Juma has been in the agrobusiness for more than nine years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. His loving wife is also engaged in this business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the wellbeing of his family. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $2,500 USD. With the desire to realize his plan, Juma appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.
