She has requested this loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenge has been lack of an organized market for her products. In five years time, she hopes to have improved her dairy farming by owning at least three high-yielding dairy cows that will be producing at least 50 litres of milk daily.

She comments that Juhudi is doing a great job by empowering small-scale farmers and that the future is bright with the financial assistance from Juhudi.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: This is 30 year-old Mariatu. She is married and has three children ages 12, 10 and 8. Mariatu established her used clothing business because she wanted a means of bringing in income to help her husband support their children. Her business is open 7 days a week, 11 hours a day. Mariatu has a very good credit history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy more used clothing for her business. Mariatu intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate her children and provide a better life for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis is a dealer in local brew and cattle. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda with his wife and five children aged 16, 14, 12, 8 and 4 years old. He looks after a family of 11 people in a house he constructed for the family. He has been into the cattle business for most of his life since childhood he says. This is the fifth loan for Clovis from HOFOKAM and he intends to use the loan proceeds to buy cattle and local brew for selling at a margin.

loans.use: To buy cattle and local brew for selling at a margin

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two sons. She is a small-market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Natalya sells retail items, i.e. household products, ceramic figurines, dishware, thermometers, brushes, batteries, etc. Her kiosk always offers a nice selection of assorted merchandise, which attracts potential customers.  

Natalya has been in the trade for seven years. She has invested about 65,000 Grivnyas in her venture. She is working hard to sustain her business and secure its expansion. Natalya is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital. This loan will enable Natalya to provide a wide range of assorted products for sale in her kiosk and will help guarantee consistent growth in her business, which is key to her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 6 years. Her farm produces milk and eggs which she sells to the local market. Her biggest challenge in farming has been disease, which affects her dairy cows.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire another asset that will generate income through the sale of milk. The income from this loan will help her improve the livelihood of her family. In future, she would like to acquire 4 more dairy cows, a posho mill and a chuff-cutter that will enable her to expand her farming.

Alice is 35 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children who attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda is married. She sells clothing at one of the small markets in Tursunzade city. Mavlyuda has been in this business for 2 years. She enjoys selling women's shoes very much. Her clients see that and come back. Mavlyuda would like to borrow $1,500 USD to increase her assortment of shoes. Her goal is to develop her business further and open a second location.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj .

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.

Zam has a business of selling spare parts. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Zam sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. Zam has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of spare parts. She also generates additional income through owning a motorcycle for hire.The main business challenge(s) for Zam include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing spare parts from Japan.

Zam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of sapre parts.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is doing that because at the moment he is riding another person’s motorcycle and now he wants to own one. He is 28 years old, married with one child aged 3 years. He looks after a family of four people living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last 10 years. 

Vincent adds that fuel shortage is a major challenge to the motorcycle business sector. He says he has always hoped to have his own motorcycle and with access to this loan, he will be able to acquire one for himself for income generation.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en: Burastan K. has been selling shoes since 1998. She is a very energetic and successful businesswoman. Burastan has good relationships with many customers, who are very satisfied with her positive attitude, personalized service, and who prefer buying shoes only from her. To acquire new shoes for her inventory, Burastan has applied for this loan to cover part of her costs.

loans.use: purchasing new shoes for her inventory

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a 1-year-old son. She is a farmer from predominantly agricultural Kherson region of Ukraine. Olesya lives in a small town of Privetnoye. She grows early spring vegetables to sell them wholesale in the markets of her region. Olesya has been in this business for 8 years. Presently, she has already invested 12,000 Grivnyas in this business. Her net profit amounts to 35,00 Grivnyas per season.

Olesya is planning to buy a dripping irrigation unit, fertilizers, farming chemicals, polyethylene film, seeds and wood for greenhouse heating. Therefore, she is requesting a 6,000 Grivnya loan. Olesya also breeds pigs which provides an additional source of income for herself and her family. She is hoping to continue growing her farming and cattle breeding businesses as they are the only ways to survive in small town neighborhoods like the one she is from.

Note: In the photo, Olesya is pictured with her mother.

loans.use: To purchase a dripping irrigation unit, fertilizers, farming chemicals, polyethylene film, seeds and wood for greenhouse heating.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina K. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and tomatoes at home and is requesting a loan to stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Selina is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a police man. She has 6 children and 3 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her family.

loans.use: To stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with two children who go to school. He runs the 'Samchem' chemist to earn a living. In his chemist's shop he sells drugs, soft drinks and cosmetics.

Samuel started running the business three years ago. He was previously selling charcoal and fruit to earn a living. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to stabilize his business. He has requested 70,000 KES to buy more cosmetics in readiness for the peak season.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old single man living alone. He is a construction worker with almost ten years experience. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works on local projects at the request of his clients. He has requested a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., with which he will purchase more wood for his newest project.
 
In the future he is planning to improve his work and to expand his business operation by taking on bigger projects, and to start working with construction entrepreneurs to develop his work and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron has been practicing mixed farming for sixteen years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas and tea which are sold locally and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been weather changes especially drought which affects his production.

Haron is 49 years old. He is married with 6 school-aged children who are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. He says that the dairy cow will be an added asset to the family. The proceeds from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children. In future, he hopes that the proceeds from his farm will enable him open a cereals and general shop in the same region.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 32-year-old man, married with five children. He lives in a township called Fort Portal in Uganda. He is the sole breadwinner of his family which lives in a semi-permanent house that he managed to construct. Thomas operates a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for the last four years. He says he got capital to buy a motorcycle for his transport business from farming. He adds that he would like to have more motorcycles for the business thus the need for a loan. Thomas intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Analyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Analyn wants her children to finish college so she works hard to achieve it. 

Analyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en: Gegham S. lives together with his brother and mother.  He set up a clothing business in 2003. In the beginning he had to travel to several countries for clothing purchases. Through the years his punctuality and good reputation earned him respect and trust from the traders. Now Gegham puts in his orders directly from Armenia. With his brother’s help, this enthusiastic young man is able to earn income to support the household. Recently Gegham has received several orders from his customers and needs to purchase new inventory. This loan will assist him greatly.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 24-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a peasant and together they have two children aged 6 and 4 years. He lives in a household of five people in a rented house. He dreams of having a good family standard of living. 

Robert currently is into the retail shop business and motorcycle transport. He has been in business for the last three years. Before that, Robert used to ride a bicycle for his transport business. He intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, cooking oil and domestic items

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Linda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Linda also grows ducks to produce and sell eggs. She says it helps to have another source of income.

Linda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to fund her farm. She will purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 29 years old and he has two children. He runs a welding business for a living.   He has three years of experience in the business and has managed to employ three people.  He also works on contract to earn extra income.  He sees himself opening another business outlet in the future.  He has requested for 30, 000 Kes to buy machines for welding.

loans.use: To buy machines for welding

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old-single man living alone. He has ten years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2004. He only cultivates vegetables. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. 

Today he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a cultivating machine for his agriculturA. work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.  In the future, he is planning to start  cultivation fruit on his land.

loans.use: purchase a cultivating machine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is currently in the business of making tea and bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Grace is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a doctor. She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two grown children. He is a farmer from the small town of Vodyanoye. There are basically no jobs to be found in this town which is why Alexander decided to try his luck in farming 10 years ago. He has constructed 5 big arch greenhouses to grow early spring vegetables and sell them wholesale. Alexander has already invested 70,000 Grivnyas in his business. Every year he spends about 10,000 – 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film to protect greenhouses. 

Alexander has recently purchased two farmland lots. He is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to build one or possibly two greenhouses on his new property. The agricultural business is very prospective in this region where there are barely any other employment options. Alexander is hoping to expand his venture and receive additional profit from increased sales.

loans.use: to construct an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia D. is currently in the business of selling sugar, beans etc at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Lilia is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a lawyers clerk. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena S. sells women's clothing. She lives alone.  After leaving her university lecturer’s career with its low salary, Yelena found her interest in business in which she has been engaged for  11 years already. Yelena has good relationships with her permanent customers, who have recently shown demand for particular clothing. Yelena’s current income does not allow her to purchase that inventory. To cover the purchasing costs Yelena has applied for this loan.

loans.use: purchasing clothing inventory

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: Masika M.  est  présidente du groupe Espoir, âgée de 60 ans, divorcée, mère de 7 enfants, parmi ces naissances, il ya des jumeaux. Tous ses enfants ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle  fait le commerce de boisson locale Mandale. Elle commence cette activité dans  sa petite jeunesse.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$, vers les années 2008. Dit-elle,  cette activité a fait grandir ses enfants. Elle vend à son domicile. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner des matières premières de production boisson Mandale (3sacs de maïs, sorgho, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne acheter d’autres parcelles pour ces enfants. La cliente Masika M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Espoir est  composé de 19 membres.
texts.en: Masika M. is the president of the Espoir group. She is 60 years old, divorced, and has 7 children, some of whom are twins. All of her children have their own families. She runs a business selling a local drink called Mandale. She began this activity when she was very young, and later benefited from a loan of $50 through the microfinance institution Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners) around 2008. She says that this business has helped her raise her children. She sells her products at her home. This new loan will serve to obtain supplies of the raw ingredients to produce Mandale (3 bags of maize, sorghum, etc.). Furthermore, she aspires to buy additional plots of land for her children. Masika is grateful to Hekima for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from mainstream banking. It should be noted that the Espoir group is composed of 19 members.

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of maize, sorghum, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 58 years old. Julieta is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Julieta also runs a sari-sari store where snacks and other products are sold. She also plans to raise pigs and start a small piggery.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs, piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, piglets and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga O. is a widow. Her husband died seven months ago from pneumonia. Olga has a grown son, Sergey, and two teenage daughters. She is a small town farmer from Kamenka. Olga grows early spring vegetables such as tomatoes and radishes for further retail sale in her region. Olga owns two arch greenhouses. She started this business 25 years ago. She has already invested about 30000 UAH in her enterprise. She spends about 5000 to 7000 UAH on seeds and film every year. 

Olga is requesting a loan of 10000 UAH to construct a greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film for it. The additional greenhouse will provide an opportunity to grow more tomatoes, sell them and receive additional income as a result. After the tragic loss of her husband, Olga was forced to find ways to provide for her family on her own. Lending assistance will be a timely support for this needy family at this challenging period in their lives.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is 49 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school. 

Mary is currently in the business of selling beans and charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a charcoal store.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah M. is 59 years old and married with seven grown children. Three of his children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years and employs three farmhands. His farm produces tea, bananas, maize and milk, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his bookshop in the same area.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and expand his business operations. His primary challenges have been lack of enough money to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and animal feeds, as well as low market prices and the poor road network in the area, which hinders transportation to the market.

He aspires to have 10 dairy cows in five years and to expand his bookshop. He is grateful to Juhudi for helping rural people improve their lives.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Mary is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with grown son and a daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye. Tatyana sells office supplies, dishware and umbrellas in the local market called ‘Yubileinyi’. She owns three vending locations in the same marketplace. She launched her enterprise thirteen years ago. Currently, Tatyana has over 70,000 UAH in inventory. Her gross income is over approximately $2540 a month. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase her turnover capital and purchase assorted merchandise. She is planning to buy additional office supplies and dishware for further retail sale in her kiosks. Tatyana decided to work in this sphere of trade because there is less competition, and this type of merchandise always sells well.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. is currently in the business of selling soda and ice cream at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Rose is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has five children and two of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two grown children. She is a market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Yelena sells children’s footwear in the local market called ‘Yubileinyi’. Yelena has been working in this sphere for thirteen years. Presently, she has about 35,000 UAH invested in this business. Her monthly gross income is about $2800. 

Yelena is requesting a 12,000 UAH loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase assorted winter boots for children. Yelena’s merchandise is always in demand. The current loan will enable her to buy additional inventory in bulk. Yelena is always on the lookout for good prices from suppliers that will allow her to make a profit. By having an adequate amount of capital available, she can maximize her opportunities and continue developing a solid business.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 34 years old and married. To make a living, Mary Grace raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also owns a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells products like chips, biscuits and many others. 

Mary Grace joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and feed for them, as well as additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married and has a one-year-old son named Vladislav. He is a businessman from Drogobych. Sergyi sells men’s and women’s footwear and clothing items at three different vending locations in his home town. All his kiosks are located in busy public places where hundreds of potential customers pass every day. Sergyi launched his venture six years ago. Currently, he has 60,000 UAH in inventory. His gross income amounts to approximately $3050 a month. 

Sergyi is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH to purchase additional clothing and footwear merchandise in order to re-stock inventory at the three vending locations that he owns. He sells shoes and clothes at affordable prices, focusing on low-income social groups in his town. Sergyi started out small and has been consistently growing his business. His venture is a good example of entrepreneurial enthusiasm, persistence and determination.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Susanne

texts.en: Susanna S. sells women’s clothing.  She lives in a big family with nine members where everybody pays his token to improve the family’s financial status. Susanna is a kind and caring grandmother, wishing to invest in her grandchildren’s education and future professional careers. A dedicated mother, grandmother and entrepreneur,  Susanna requires to purchase new clothing stock, for which she needs additional financial resources.

loans.use: purchasing new clothing stock

loans.name: Be Honest Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the two members of the “Be Honest” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to help them improve their businesses.

The leader of this group is Fatmata J..  Fatmata is age forty; she was born in Waterloo, where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a teacher and two of her children are attending primary school and two are in secondary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for twenty years now; she sells market food items – groundnuts, rice, palm oil, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy groundnuts, rice, palm oil, sugar, etc. in larger quantity

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. is currently in the business of selling bread along the roadside and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Mary is 48 years old and is married to a doctor. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 34 years old, married and has three children.  He is a cobbler and he runs his business in a very busy environment.  He has engaged in the business for ten years.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya for training him on business management skills.  He hopes to stabilize his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 16,500 KES to buy shoe soles for repairing worn-out shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoe soles for repairing worn-out shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky N.  is currently in the business of selling charcoal and fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Vicky is 40 years old and is married to a watchman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike to transport charcoal to her home.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Brenda

texts.en:
Ma. Brenda S. is from the town of Surallah. She is 42 years old. Ma. Brenda is married and has four children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 14. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She says the store helps in her family's daily needs and she is happy about it.

Ma. Brenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a display refrigerator

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona T. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell.  Lona is 20 years old and is married to a builder. She has one child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
TULIA M. A.
Tulia es una socia del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes que pertenece a la provincia de Coronel Portillo. Tiene de 55 años de edad,  casada,  su esposo se desempeña como chofer y es madre de 4 hijos,  queriendo mejorar  la situación de su hogar decide sacar un primer préstamo en Manuela Ramos  e invertirlo en venta de comida el cual le alcanzaba para empezar dicho negocio.
Viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos hace 7 años,  se dedica la venta de comida, dando desayunos  desde las primeras horas de la mañana, termina  a las 9 de la mañana y luego se dedica a otra actividad.
Para dar más comodidad a sus clientes, Ha decidido  invertir   los S/. 1,800.00 soles que Manuela Ramos le prestó  en  estos días, comprando  4 juegos de mesas, 4 manteles, 5 paquetes de servilleta,  1 ½ doc. de tazas, 2 docenas de vasos, 1 doc. Platos hondos y 2 fuentes.
La señora Tulia ahora podrá coberturar y/o atender más clientes, el que le da cierta tranquilidad por el trabajo que tiene, le generará mayores ingresos a su hogar, y está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Tulia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Courageous Women), which in Coronel Portillo Province. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a chauffeur. Tulia wanted to improve her household situation, so she decided to request her first loan from Manuela Ramos and used the funds to sell food, thereby starting her business.

She started working with Manuela Ramos seven years ago. Tulia sells food, preparing breakfasts in the early morning hours until 9am. Afterwards, she spends time in her other activities. In order to make her customers more comfortable, she decided to invest the loan of 1800 PEN from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of four sets of tables, four tablecloths, five packs of napkins, one and a half dozen cups, two dozen glasses, one dozen plates, and two dozen bowls.

Sra. Tulia will now be able to accommodate and serve more customers, which gives her more peace of mind in her work. Since she will able to generate more income for her home, Tulia is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, and dishes

loans.name: Masiaday Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Masiaday II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in the small town of Waterloo where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariama M.. Mariama is age thirty-four; she was born in Port Loko town but currently resides in Waterloo together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman, too, and one of her children is in primary school while the other three are in secondary school. Mariama sells meat and has been doing this business for fifteen years now. With this loan, she will buy more meats in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Buys more meats in order to expand her business

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is an active member of Motemomwamu group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for fifteen years. His mixed farm produces maize, tea and bananas which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to fulfill the needs of his family. 

Boaz is 39 years old. He is married with five children who are now between the ages of 7 months and 12 years. Three of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. However, he faces the challenge of the lack of finances to buy enough farm supplies. He hopes that in the future he will be able to acquire more dairy cows and expand his farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
}La señora Clara Vásquez es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, con domicilio en el distrito de Callería departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es casada sin hijos   y  su esposo se desempeña como mecánico. Con su primer préstamo  que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos, la señora Clara pensó en dedicarse  a la venta de productos de belleza.

También recibió capacitación para prestar servicio de manicure para complementar la venta de sus productos de belleza, en Manuela Ramos. Clara esta desde la fundación del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes. 

Con el préstamo que acaba de recibir  de Manuela Ramos  que asciende a la suma  S/. 1,800.00  soles el mismo que será devuelto en 4 cuotas mensuales. Con el dinero recibido incrementará el capital de trabajo de su pequeño negocio de confección de sabanas y secadores. Invertirá de la siguiente manera, 30 metros de tela para sabanas, 6 conos de hilos de diferentes colores, 10 metros de  tela toalla para los secadores, una docena de aplicaciones, 20 metros de pasa cintas, 3 unidades de cinta satinadas, y también mandará a reparar su máquina.

Clara con los préstamos que recibe por parte de Manuela Ramos apoya en la economía del hogar, su negocio crece, y está mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Clara Vásquez is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Courageous Women).  She resides along Coronel Portillo Jr., in the District of Callería, Department of Ucayali.  Clara is 40 years old, married, and does not have children.  Her husband works as a mechanic.  With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Sra. Clara began selling beauty products.

She also received training from Manuela Ramos in manicure services to complement her beauty product sales business.  Clara is also the founder of the Courageous Women Communal Bank.

The loan Clara will receive from Manuela Ramos is in the amount of 1800 PEN, which will be repaid in four monthly installments.  This money will increase her operating capital for her small business making bed linens and dish towels.  She will invest the funds in the following manner:  30 meters of fabric for making linens, 6 cones of thread in different colors, 10 meters of terry cloth for making dish towels, one dozen appliqués, 20 meters of fabric borders, and 3 units of glittering borders.  Clara will also send out her machine for repair.

With the loans from Manuela Ramos Clara will be able to support the household finances, grow her business, and improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married with five children aged 12, 8, 6, 4, 2 years and his wife is a peasant farmer. He lives with his family of seven people in his own residential house. John operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the last five years. Before that, John was a farmer full time. 

He adds that price fluctuations are his main challenge but he hopes to see his shop grow in the near future. The purpose of the loan is to enable John to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil and other domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, salt, cooking oil and other domestic items

loans.name: Salyn James

texts.en:
Salyn James L. is from the town of Banga. He is 30 years old and married to a researcher. He has a two-year-old child. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He does his best to be able to provide all his family's needs.

Salyn James joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Willis

texts.en: Willis is 32 years old and a member of 'Amani Pumwani' group in Faulu Kenya.  He irons second-hand clothes before they are sold.  He has been running the business for eight years.  He also runs a retail shop so as to boost his income.  He has been able to serve his customers well because he has been trained by Faulu Kenya in good customer care.  He hopes to start a business selling second-hand shoes hence he has requested 20,000 Kes to buy shoes.  He describes himself as a hardworking, honest and God-fearing man.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
SARA P. M.
L a señorita  Sara pertenece al banco comunal  Luchando por nosotras. Del distrito calleria departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años de edad, soltera y con muchas ganas de trabajar se dedica a la venta de comida, y golosinas en tablero en forma ambulatoria.
Todos los días tiene que salir a vender las viandas que prepara y  movilizar los enseres que va utilizar, también carga con la mesa , la cocina a carbón y los bancos que necesita para dar comodidad a las personas que  asisten a desayunar,  su trabajo empieza a las primeras horas de la mañana   y termina a las 8 am. Porque  sirve solo desayunos.
Sara invertirá los s/. 1,500 soles que Manuela Ramos le prestó en la compra de enseres: 1 doc. De platos,  ½ doc. De cuchara, ½ doc. Tasas,  1 juego de ollas, 2 manteles, 1 paquete de servilleta  y también comprara 2 juegos de mesas.
La señorita Sara está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque gracias a los préstamos está trabajando por cuenta propia y no  tiene que depender de nadie.  Ella se pone su horario y puede realizar otras actividades durante el día.
texts.en:
Srta. Sara is a member of the Communal Bank “Luchando Por Nosotras” (Fighting For Us), which in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 24 years old, single, and enjoys working at her business selling food and candy as a street vendor.

Every day Sara goes out to sell the food she prepares and move the equipment that she uses. She brings with her a table, a grill, charcoal, and benches to make her customers comfortable while they are having breakfast. Sara starts working in the early morning hours and finishes at 8am since she only serves breakfast.

She will invest her loan of 1500 PEN from Manuela Ramos in the following supplies: one dozen plates, a half dozen spoons, a half dozen cups, one set of pots, two tablecloths, one packet of napkins, and two sets of tables. Srta. Sara is grateful to Manuela Ramos because these loans have enabled her to work on her own and not have to depend on anyone. She sticks to her schedule and is able to complete her other daily activities.

loans.use: Purchase dishes & supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single woman living with her two sisters. For the past three years, she has been running a clothing and lingerie store. Her business income is vital to support her family and to get a good life situation. 

She has obtained a previous loan through Kiva and she is very thankful for her decision. Now she is requesting a new, larger $2,000 loan through Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. This loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she hopes to sell shoes in addition to clothes at her store.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix Díaz tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el Barrio La Amistad de Cambyreta,  es casado, tiene 4 hijos. 
El señor Félix, hace 13 años que se dedica a la venta al rubro de gomeria y arreglo de bicicletas.
 Mediante esta actividad pueden solventar  sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le presente. 
El ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de cubiertas para  motos y bicicletas ya que también es solicitado por sus clientes este servicio de reparación de motos y bicicletas.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix Díaz is 51 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Amistad de Cambyreta. He is married and has four children.

Sr. Félix has been selling tires and repairing bicycles for 13 years. His business enables him to meet his expenses and cover any unforeseen events that may occur. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy motorcycle and bicycle tires since his customers are requesting his repair services.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle & bicycle tires

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Saffiatu.  She is married and has 3 children aged 12, 16, and 8 years. In the year 2006, Saffiatu established her DVD players, DVD discs and video show business. She started this business when she received initial business capital from her husband. The business was started mainly to generate enough profit to help her husband in supporting their family. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 430,000SLL every month from this business. Saffiatu has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 3,000,000SLL.  Saffiatu requires a loan in order to add more DVD players, DVD discs and a bigger screen television for her video shows. In the future, Saffiatu plans to educate her children to university level and build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more DVD players, DVD discs and a big-screen television

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 29-year-old lady operating a grocery in the town of Fort Portal, Uganda. She is married and has two children and lives in a family of three people in a family house. Her major dream is to educate her children and see them become successful in life. On the business front, Edith says she would like to see her shop transform from retail to wholesale. She has been in the retail business for one year now though she says that she has a problem of bad debtors. In this school season, Edith says she wants the loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her child

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old; he sells glasses to earn a living.  With his income, he is able to raise his three children who go to school.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has grown, hence his living standards have improved. He has been running the business for two years with one employee. In five years, he hopes to employ more people in his business.  With the loan of 20,000 Kes, he will buy more glasses.

loans.use: To buy more glasses

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has 4 children aged 15, 10, 8 and 4 years. In 2001, Aminata established her provisions such as milk, sugar, margarine, sardine etc. and bottled drinks business. She began her own business after gaining enough experience from her elder sister. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 380,000 SLL every month from this business. Aminata has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more drinks, sugar, milk, margarine, sardine and oval tine for her business. She intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate her children and help to provide livelihood for them. In the future, Aminata plans to build a house for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, sugar, milk, margarine, sardine and oval tine.

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en: Suzi D. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials.  Suzi is 24 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and only one goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A.  is currently in the business of making and selling tea alongside the road and is requesting a loan to stock more coffee, sugar, etc for making hot drinks to sell.  Mary is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has  four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more coffee, sugar, etc. for making tea to sell

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard has been practicing mixed farming for seven years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His farm produces eggs which he sells at the local market. He also owns a motorbike which he uses for transportation to supplement his income. He says that his biggest challenge has been diseases that have been very costly to treat.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000KES and has requested this loan of 75,000KES to expand his poultry project. He says that with the proceeds from this project, his children are assured of a good education and food sustainability in the family. He would like to expand his farm in future to enable him to venture into dairy farming.

He is requesting Juhudi to shorten the loan processing period to enable clients to budget promptly and repay easily.

Bernard is 28 years old. He is married with two children, ages 2 and 6. His elder child is currently attending school.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a father of six children. He is a man living in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family of eight people. Joseph is married and his wife is a peasant farmer. Joseph is in the transport business, operating a taxi, and has been in the business for eight years. He says he was a mechanic before becoming a driver. He adds that fuel prices fluctuate so much that they affect his business projections. He says he looks forward to buying another vehicle for his transport business in the near future. Joseph intends to use the loan proceeds to buy new tyres for his vehicle for his transport business.

loans.use: Buying new tyres for his vehicle

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has two children aged 26 and 22 years. In 1985, Amie established her used clothing business. She began her business because she believed this can be a means for getting income to provide support to her children. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 430,000 SLL every month from this business.  She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL.   

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more bales of used clothing.   In the future, Amie plans to educate her children and to buy a plot of land.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela Rodríguez González  tiene 40 años de edad, vive en  Barrio San Pedro, tiene su vivienda, y  es madre soltera.
La señora Graciela  es muy trabajadora y con mucho sacrificio logró abrir su negocio, por los actualmente es comerciante posee una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio además elabora masas, pan casero, tortas para la venta y los vende en su negocio.
 Mediante esta actividad pueden solventar  sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le presente se dedican a esta actividad hace mas de 10 años.  
Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de productos de consumo familiar, bebidas, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela Rodríguez González is 40 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Pedro where she has a home. She is a single mother.

Sra. Graciela is a hard worker who has made great sacrifices to open her business. She is currently a merchant who has a well-stocked store in her home. In addition she produces cookies, homemade bread, and cakes to sell at her business. This business enables her to meet her expenses and prepare herself for any unexpected emergency. Graciela has been in business for more than ten years.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy household consumer products such as beverages, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Akwata Empola Womens,  Mubende Group

texts.en:
With hard work and high self-esteem, K. Berna, aged 24, has tried beyond limits to maintain a clothing and shoe retail shop that she has been operating for over two years in Kyenda, Mubende, alongside her teaching activities. Being one of the most attractive businesses here in Uganda, many business entrepreneurs have tried to invest in clothing sales, as it normally captures the local customers’ attention.  Berna is among the lucky ones benefiting from it through making sales in seasonal markets. 

With this loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more stock for her business as her drawback has been having little capital. She also hopes to be in a position to transform the business with extensive shopping for more bales of clothes, thus improving her incomes. This will allow her to live up to her goals of educating her children and increasing family income. 

She belongs to Akwata Empola women's group with other members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase of more stock for her business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 38-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married and his wife is a peasant farmer. They have eight children and so look after a family of ten people. Patrick operates a butcher shop and has been in the business for the last 20 years. He adds that in his business, capital is ever an issue depending on demand for beef. Patrick intends to use the loan proceeds to buy goats to sell as meat at his butcher shop.

loans.use: Buying goats to sell as meat

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe Group 2-Mpigi

texts.en:
Firmness of purpose and fearlessness is what 30-year-old S. John who makes common cause with Bulenga Twekembe group has banked on to make sure his clothes sales business in Bulenga-Mpigi does not sink into stagnant oblivion. His self-confidence too has come in handy through the course of the past few years that he has been in operation. Previously, he was preoccupied with a farming enterprise, that he  says with nostalgia was a worthwhile learning experience on how to smoothly run a business. 100,000 shillings is what totals up as his weekly business profits. 

John is happily married with two kids. He is requesting this loan to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a businessman who runs a grocery.  In addition, he does motorbike transport which he started recently.  With the income from his business, he is able to support his wife and his five children who are all in school. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to start his motorbike transport business.  He hopes to educate his children and expand his business in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy another motorbike for his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a new polishing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items such as cuerina (delicate leather), linings and fabrics to make wallets and bags.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise is 26 years old and she is married.  Denise is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs, mainly beans, and this is her fourth year in this business which she works at from 7 am to 8 pm every day.  

Denise needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, she will hopefully expand her business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, peas, etc.  With these additional foodstuffs for sale, Denise will hopefully earn more profits than previously and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, peas, etc.

loans.name: Agahikane Karungu Parish Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
Self-motivated and hard-working N. Wilberforce of Agahikane Karungu Parish group, Kyenjojo, is 42 and a married father of seven aged between 19 and 5 years. He has been operating a retail shop business selling general products for home use in Kawarinju trading centre, Mubende. He started this business 5 years ago, realizing the ready market in the area, and at the end of every month he is able to pocket profits to the tune of 120,000 Ugandan shillings. 

His main drawback has been having small stock in his business that cannot match the purchasing rate of the customers. He is therefore seeking a loan that he figures will help him stock more goods that will satisfy the customers’ high demand and also transform his small enterprise into a big enterprise. 
Being very committed to the business with good customer care, he hopes to increase his sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in his business as he hopes to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for his children’s education expenses.

loans.use: purchase of more stock

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is 41 years old, married with three children who are 6, 12 and 14 years old.  Marc is commonly known in the business of raising cows and it is through his livestock that he gets milk for sale.  Marc has been in this business for about 10 years.  

Marc needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Marc will buy more cows which will allow him to get enough milk for sale.  Once the sale of milk increases, the profits will increase and when the profits increase, he will create some other sources of income as well as jobs for the people from his community and in addition to that, he will continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: buying more cows to raise and getting milk for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 10 children, all of whom are in school.  Fatuma has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products retail, at the market.    

Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more, bunches of bananas.     She also generates additional income through selling piped water.The main business challenges for Fatuma include transportation   and the rainy season .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also educate her children up to university.  

 Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42 years old, married with four children who are between 9 and 21 years old.  Bernard is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs mainly beans and some other goods.  Bernard has been in this business for about six years.  The business hours are from 7 am to 10 pm every day.

Although Bernard has been in this business for about 6 years, his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, peas, wheat, etc.  With these additional foodstuffs for sale, he will hopefully earn more profits than previously and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Abass.  He is married and has three children aged 9, 6 and 4. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because the one is his brother's sister and the other is his neighbour son's; they came for assistance for their schooling. 

 In 1982, Abass established his Ready-Made-Wear business. He began his business because he wants to be self reliant. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about 2,214,000 SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy jeans, shirts, and T-shirts, etc. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 332,100 SLL. 

In the future, Abass hopes to improve his business, build another house, and educate his children to university level. He serves the entire Bo community; he also encourages customers, and he travels by road to neighbouring countries to buy his goods. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, and T-shirts etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es:
Remedios solicito 1000 $us; se dedica a la comercialización de discos compactos, cassetes, al por menor, en su puesto de venta ubicado en plena vía publica.
El crédito le servirá para aumento de capital y así poder adquirir mercadería al por mayor. Es el segundo  crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
Remedios vive en Villa tunari, zona ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto; está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Remedios asked for  US $1000. She sells compact disks, and cassettes retail at her locale right on a public street.  

The loan will be used to increase capital and thus be able to acquire merchandise wholesale. This is the second loan from Impro and the second one via Kiva.  

Remedios lives in Villa Tunari, an area located in the city of El Alto. She is married and has 4 children.

loans.use: To buy CDs and cassettes wholesale for her retail business.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en achacachi comunidad humajalsu. El es productor lechero y agricultor junto con su esposa se dedican a esta actividad cotidianamente, es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene dos hijos.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera, lo que le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro. El análisis socio económico le permite solicitar el crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives in his own home in the Humajalsu community of Achacachi.  He is a dairy producer and farmer.  He does this job every day together with his wife.  It is his main source of income for supporting his family.  He has two children.

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow which will allow him to increase his milk production and consequently his income.

This is his first loan with Impro.  Their socioeconomic analysis has allowed him to request a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Nueva Esperanza  esta compuesta por tres integrantes  2 mujeres  y un varón,  La representante del grupo es la Sra. Celia es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora se dedica a la venta D. verduras el dinero del credito sera para la compra D. mercaderia como ser tomate por cajas, zanahoria una carga, etc y asi D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo, viven  en la zona D. Villa Obrajes, es un grupo D. amigos  D.  hace muchos años, son muy conocidos  por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras,  trabajan todos los días, el préstamo lo destinaran para su mercadería , compra D. una garrafa y azúcar , herramientas D. trabajo, están muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The Nueva Esperanza support group is maD. up of three members, 2 women and one man. The group representative is Celia. She is a very responsible and hard working woman who sells vegetables. The money from the loan will be used to buy merchandise such as crates of tomatoes, a load of carrots, etc. In this way she will increase her working capital. They live in the Villa Obrajes area. This is a group of long time friends who are well known for being responsible and hardworking people. They work everyday. The loan will be used for merchandise such as a barrel of sugar, and work tools. They are very grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert, es transportista publico de trufi inter-ciudad La Paz El Alto; vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero.
El crédito que solicita es para cubrir el costo de transformación de su vehiculo de Gasolina a Gas natural, para rebajar el costo del combustible, pues el gas es más barato que la gasolina.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y a través de Kiva. El análisis de su flujo de caja indica que Robert es sujeto de crédito.

 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Robert is a public transportation driver on the La Paz-El Alto inter-city route.  He is single and lives with his parents in the Llojeta neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  

He is asking for this loan to cover the cost of converting his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas to reduce the cost of fuel.  Natural gas is less expensive than gasoline.

This is the first time he has gotten a loan with IMPRO through Kiva.

loans.use: Cost of converting his passenger vehicle from gasoline to natural gas

loans.name: Kassim Ole Mande

texts.en:
Kassim O. N. is a thirty-year-old farmer from Kilgoris town, which is situated south of the Great Rift Valley. He is married to Saida, a twenty-five-year-old lady who also does farming. The couple has two children, Lekakeny and Lekishon, and they reside in Magwara Village.

Kassim  who is the family breadwinner does farming in the rich and fertile Kilgoris town area.  He does  mainly maize farming, a crop which does well in that area, and has been doing this business for the last nine years. His zeal to expand forced him to join KADET LTD for a loan and he is now taking his first loan of Kshs 20,000 which he will use to buy maize seedlings, fertilizer and pay labor for the people he will engage during planting season.

Kassim is optimistic and he hopes to see his farming business expand. He believes through this he will be able to make extra income and thus improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and maize seedlings

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abu Bakarr.  He is married, and has two children aged 8 and 1. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because they came in as family assistance and for their schooling. 

 In 1999, Abu Bakarr established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to develop self-reliance. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 910,000SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy bales of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 182,000SLL. 

In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to complete his house, to expand his business, and to educate his children to university level so that they can take care of him when he is old. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Victoria Hayde

texts.es:
La señorita Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, del distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali.  Victoria tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su  primer préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos fue de s/. 300 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar golosinas.

Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 meses.  Debido a la demanda, ha decidido vender otros productos, tiene pensado vender pollo broaster (comida al paso) para lo cual cuenta con una freidora. 

Con éste crédito de  s/. 1000 nuevos soles, comprará 6 cajas de panetones para venderlos a crédito en los asentamientos humanos de la zona, porque vio que es un negocio muy rentable en esta época de fin de año. 
Gracias a Manuela Ramos y a su esfuerzo está generando sus propios ingresos, por eso agradece la oportunidad de ser socia.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" [Brave Women] in the Yarinacocha district of the department of Ucayali. At her 21 years of age, she is single, and she sells basic grocery items. Her first loan from Manuela Ramos was for 300 new soles, which she used to buy candy.

She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for the past 8 months. Due to high demand, she has decided to start selling other products, and is planning to start to sell broasted chicken (fast food), for which she already has a deep fryer. 

With this loan of 1,000 new soles, she will buy six boxes of panetón [a fluffy Peruvian fruit cake] to sell on credit in populated areas, as she has seen that it is a very profitable business in this end-of-the-year season. 
Thanks to Manuela Ramos and her own efforts she is generating her own income. She appreciates the opportunity to be a member of the organization.

loans.use: To purchase fruitcake

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 29 years old and married.  For nine years, he has been operating a barber shop to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more determined in his business. So far, he has managed to employ two people.  He hopes to open more barber shops in the future.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Rugiatu.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 6, 10, 14 years. She has no additional dependents.  In 1995, Rugiatu established her pans and plastic utensil business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 600,000SLL every month from this business. Rugiatu has a very good credit history.She needs a loan of 3,000,000SLL. Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more plastic utensil for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 800,000SLL.Rugiatu intends to use the proceeds from this business to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German  vive en casa propia en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado y todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad; la actividad que realiza es la confección de chompas de lana en un pequeño taller que instaló en su domicilio en el cual trabaja con su esposa.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (lana) y poder mantener su negocio estable.

Es cliente antiguo y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
German lives in his own home in the Tacagua neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  He is married and all of his children are grown.  

He works making wool sweaters in a small workshop located in his home.  His wife works there too.

He is asking for this loan to purchase material (wool) and to keep his business stable.

He is an old customer and pays on time, so he is eligible for a new loan.

loans.use: Purchase wool for his sweater making business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge O. tiene 60 años de edad, está casado desde hace muchos años con la señora Alicia González de O., tienen hijos ya adultos que viven todos de manera independiente cada uno de ellos con sus respectivas familias. Viven en su propia casa situada en Barrio Santa María Cambyreta.

El señor Jorge y la señora Alicia poseen una amplia propiedad en donde tienen animales, vacas, caballos, gallinas, cerdos, conejos y otros. Ellos se dedican a la venta de leche y huevos, y eventualmente cerdos y gallinas, tienen mucha clientela de la zona a quienes diariamente les distribuyen leche. La señora Alicia es la encargada del cuidado de la casa y de atender a los animales, mientras el señor Jorge es el que se encarga de salir a distribuir la leche todos los días. Gracias a esta actividad ellos pueden mantener su hogar y solventar todos los gastos e imprevistos que se les presente.

Ellos han solicitado este crédito para la compra de más vacas ya que tienen oferta.
texts.en:
Jorge O. is 60 years old and has been married for many years to Alicia González de O..  They have adult children who all live independently with their own families.  They live in their own house located in the Santa María Cambyreta neighborhood.

Jorge and Alicia have a large property where they keep animals: cows, horses, chickens, pigs, rabbits, and others.  They work selling milk and eggs and will eventually sell pigs and chickens.  They have many customers in the area where they sell milk daily.  Alicia is in charge of the housekeeping and caring for the animals and Jorge is in charge of selling milk every day.  Thanks to this activity, they can maintain their home and settle all of their expenses.  

They have asked for this loan to purchase more cows that they have already bid on.

loans.use: Purchase Dutch cows for milk production
